headline: Worried About A Recession? These 10 States Have The Strongest, Most Recession-Proof Economies
summary: As we reach the midpoint of the year, recession fears are slowly abating. In May, J.P.Morgan lowered the probability of a recession occurring in 2025 from 60% to 40%. However, it still warned that a period of subpar growth could lie ahead, especially if tariffs remain high. While the news has calmed some of the fear surrounding the economy, it hasn't eliminated all of it. A survey conducted by Indeed and Harris Poll in June found that 46% of Americans are concerned about layoffs within the next

headline: Thinking About Lending Money To Family? Suze Orman Says You Might Be Hurting More Than Helping
summary: When a family member or close friend asks to borrow money, it can be hard to say no — especially if they're in a tough spot. But personal finance expert Suze Orman wants you to pause before saying yes. "Your heart will always be screaming ‘yes,'" she writes in a recent blog post. But she encourages people to take a step back and ask an important question: Is this really generous? When Generosity Isn't Mutual For Orman, generosity isn't just about helping someone else — it's also about protecting

headline: 'We've Been Served': Paul Tudor Jones Warns AI Could Be a 'Cookbook' For Humanity In A Chilling 'Twilight Zone' Warning
summary: "This is obviously the most disruptive technology in the history of mankind," billionaire investor Paul Tudor Jones said last month. "We've been served," Jones warned during an appearance on "Bloomberg Open Interest," casting artificial intelligence as a force that demands urgent scrutiny. His remarks sparked debate over looming job losses, classroom breakthroughs, and whether Congress can craft guardrails before machines outrun lawmakers. headline: Amazon Raised Prices on Hundreds of Essentials After Trump Unveiled Tariffs
summary: Embed That's the increase for inexpensive items between President Trump's unveiling of sweeping tariffs and the start of this month, according to an analysis of nearly 2,500 items. While Amazon’s prices rose on 1,200 of its cheapest household goods, competitor Walmart lowered prices on the same items by nearly 2%, the analysis found.

headline: L'ORÉAL PARIS INTRODUCES GLOBALLY RENOWNED ELVIVE GLYCOLIC + GLOSS COLLECTION TO US MARKET
summary: Following the success of two previous exclusive Walmart launches, L'Oréal Paris Elvive is thrilled to announce the release of its new Glycolic + Gloss collection, arriving exclusively at Walmart this August. Designed to deliver high-shine, glossy hair, the Glycolic + Gloss line features a Shampoo, Conditioner, and High Shine Leave-In Serum. The leave-in serum offers versatility for consumers, providing an extra boost of shine on both wet and dry hair.

The leave-in serum offers versatility for consumers, providing an extra boost of shine on both wet and dry hair.

summary: wearIQ, the smart Bluetooth glasses brand making wearable tech more accessible without cutting corners on technology, has launched exclusively at Walmart. headline: QXO Appoints Michael DeWitt as Chief Procurement Officer
summary: GREENWICH, Conn., July 21, 2025--QXO, Inc. (NYSE: QXO) today announced that Michael DeWitt has been appointed chief procurement officer, effective immediately. DeWitt will lead the company’s procurement transformation as QXO scales to become the tech-enabled leader in the $800 billion building products distribution industry.

headline: After Pledging to Keep Prices Low, Amazon Hiked Them on Hundreds of Essentials
summary: In April,  Amazon  said it would hold the line on prices.  The Journal’s analysis of prices from e-commerce data firm Traject Data found that while Amazon’s price rose on 1,200 of its cheapest household goods, competitor  Walmart  lowered prices on the same items by nearly 2%.  The divergent strategies show how major retailers are reshaping prices on popular products as uncertainty about tariffs drags on.

raw.headline: After Pledging to Keep Prices Low, Amazon Hiked Them on Hundreds of Essentials

The divergent strategies show how major retailers are reshaping prices on popular products as uncertainty about tariffs drags on.
